name: Bucket
title: Gcloud
Storage
Bucket
description:
Bucket

Represents a Storage bucket. Belongs to a Project and has many Files.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
storage = gcloud.storage

bucket = storage.bucket "my-bucket"
file = bucket.file "path/to/my-file.ext"

methods.name: kind
title: Gcloud
Storage
Bucket#kind
methods.description: The kind of item this is. For buckets, this is always storage#bucket.

methods.name: id
title: Gcloud
Storage
Bucket#id
methods.description: The ID of the bucket.

methods.name: name
title: Gcloud
Storage
Bucket#name
methods.description: The name of the bucket.

methods.name: api_url
title: Gcloud
Storage
Bucket#api_url
methods.description: A URL that can be used to access the bucket using the REST API.

methods.name: created_at
title: Gcloud
Storage
Bucket#created_at
methods.description: Creation time of the bucket.

methods.name: cors
title: Gcloud
Storage
Bucket#cors
methods.description:
Returns the current CORS configuration for a static website served from the bucket.

The return value is a frozen (unmodifiable) array of hashes containing the attributes specified for the Bucket resource field cors.

This method also accepts a block for updating the bucket’s CORS rules. See Bucket::Cors for details.

examples.caption: Retrieving the bucket’s CORS rules.
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
storage = gcloud.storage

bucket = storage.bucket "my-todo-app"
bucket.cors #=> [{"origin"=>["http://example.org"],
            #     "method"=>["GET","POST","DELETE"],
            #     "responseHeader"=>["X-My-Custom-Header"],
            #     "maxAgeSeconds"=>3600}]

examples.caption: Updating the bucket’s CORS rules inside a block.
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
storage = gcloud.storage
bucket = storage.bucket "my-todo-app"

bucket.update do |b|
  b.cors do |c|
    c.add_rule ["http://example.org", "https://example.org"],
               "*",
               response_headers: ["X-My-Custom-Header"],
               max_age: 3600
  end
end

params.name: yield
params.description: a block for setting CORS rules

params.name: yield.cors
params.description: the object accepting CORS rules

methods.name: cors=
title: Gcloud
Storage
Bucket#cors=
methods.description:
Updates the CORS configuration for a static website served from the bucket.

Accepts an array of hashes containing the attributes specified for the resource description of cors.

methods.name: location
title: Gcloud
Storage
Bucket#location
methods.description: The location of the bucket. Object data for objects in the bucket resides in physical storage within this region. Defaults to US. See the developer’s guide for the authoritative list.

methods.name: logging_bucket
title: Gcloud
Storage
Bucket#logging_bucket
methods.description: The destination bucket name for the bucket’s logs.

methods.name: logging_bucket=
title: Gcloud
Storage
Bucket#logging_bucket=
methods.description: Updates the destination bucket for the bucket’s logs.

params.name: logging_bucket
params.description: The bucket to hold the logging output

methods.name: logging_prefix
title: Gcloud
Storage
Bucket#logging_prefix
methods.description: The logging object prefix for the bucket’s logs. For more information,

methods.name: logging_prefix=
title: Gcloud
Storage
Bucket#logging_prefix=
methods.description: Updates the logging object prefix. This prefix will be used to create log object names for the bucket. It can be at most 900 characters and must be a valid object name. By default, the object prefix is the name of the bucket for which the logs are enabled.

methods.name: storage_class
title: Gcloud
Storage
Bucket#storage_class
methods.description: The bucket’s storage class. This defines how objects in the bucket are stored and determines the SLA and the cost of storage. Values include STANDARD, NEARLINE, and DURABLE_REDUCED_AVAILABILITY.

methods.name: versioning?
title: Gcloud
Storage
Bucket#versioning?
methods.description: Whether Object Versioning is enabled for the bucket.

methods.name: versioning=
title: Gcloud
Storage
Bucket#versioning=
methods.description: Updates whether Object Versioning is enabled for the bucket.

methods.name: website_main
title: Gcloud
Storage
Bucket#website_main
methods.description: The index page returned from a static website served from the bucket when a site visitor requests the top level directory.

resources.title: How to Host a Static Website

methods.name: website_main=
title: Gcloud
Storage
Bucket#website_main=
methods.description: Updates the index page returned from a static website served from the bucket when a site visitor requests the top level directory.

resources.title: How to Host a Static Website

methods.name: website_404
title: Gcloud
Storage
Bucket#website_404
methods.description: The page returned from a static website served from the bucket when a site visitor requests a resource that does not exist.

resources.title: How to Host a Static Website

methods.name: website_404=
title: Gcloud
Storage
Bucket#website_404=
methods.description: Updates the page returned from a static website served from the bucket when a site visitor requests a resource that does not exist.

resources.title: How to Host a Static Website

methods.name: update
title: Gcloud
Storage
Bucket#update
methods.description: Updates the bucket with changes made in the given block in a single PATCH request. The following attributes may be set: #cors=, #logging_bucket=, #logging_prefix=, #versioning=, #website_main=, and #website_404=. In addition, the #cors configuration accessible in the block is completely mutable and will be included in the request. (See Bucket::Cors)

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
storage = gcloud.storage

bucket = storage.bucket "my-bucket"
bucket.update do |b|
  b.website_main = "index.html"
  b.website_404 = "not_found.html"
  b.cors[0]["method"] = ["GET","POST","DELETE"]
  b.cors[1]["responseHeader"] << "X-Another-Custom-Header"
end

examples.caption: New CORS rules can also be added in a nested block:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
storage = gcloud.storage
bucket = storage.bucket "my-todo-app"

bucket.update do |b|
  b.cors do |c|
    c.add_rule ["http://example.org", "https://example.org"],
               "*",
               response_headers: ["X-My-Custom-Header"],
               max_age: 300
  end
end

params.name: yield
params.description: a block yielding a delegate object for updating the file

methods.name: delete
title: Gcloud
Storage
Bucket#delete
methods.description:
Permanently deletes the bucket. The bucket must be empty before it can be deleted.

The API call to delete the bucket may be retried under certain conditions. See Gcloud::Backoff to control this behavior.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
storage = gcloud.storage

bucket = storage.bucket "my-bucket"
bucket.delete

returns.description: Returns true if the bucket was deleted.

methods.name: files
title: Gcloud
Storage
Bucket#files
methods.description: Retrieves a list of files matching the criteria.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
storage = gcloud.storage

bucket = storage.bucket "my-bucket"
files = bucket.files
files.each do |file|
  puts file.name
end

examples.caption: Retrieve all files: (See File::List#all)
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
storage = gcloud.storage

bucket = storage.bucket "my-bucket"
files = bucket.files
files.all do |file|
  puts file.name
end

params.name: prefix
params.description:
Filter results to files whose names begin with
this prefix.

params.name: delimiter
params.description: Returns results in a directory-like mode. items will contain only objects whose names, aside from the prefix, do not contain delimiter. Objects whose names, aside from the prefix, contain delimiter will have their name, truncated after the delimiter, returned in prefixes. Duplicate prefixes are omitted.

params.name: token
params.description:
A previously-returned page token representing part
of the larger set of results to view.

params.name: max
params.description:
Maximum number of items plus prefixes to return. As
duplicate prefixes are omitted, fewer total results may be returned
than requested. The default value of this parameter is 1,000 items.

params.name: versions
params.description: If true, lists all versions of an object as distinct results. The default is false. For more information, see Object Versioning .

methods.name: file
title: Gcloud
Storage
Bucket#file
methods.description: Retrieves a file matching the path.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
storage = gcloud.storage

bucket = storage.bucket "my-bucket"

file = bucket.file "path/to/my-file.ext"
puts file.name

params.name: path
params.description: Name (path) of the file.

params.name: generation
params.description:
When present, selects a specific revision of
this object. Default is the latest version.

returns.description: Returns nil if file does not exist

methods.name: create_file
title: Gcloud
Storage
Bucket#create_file
methods.description:
Create a new File object by providing a path to a local file to upload and the path to store it with in the bucket.

A chunk_size value can be provided in the options to be used in resumable uploads. This value is the number of bytes per chunk and must be divisible by 256KB. If it is not divisible by 256KB then it will be lowered to the nearest acceptable value.

Troubleshooting large uploads

You may encounter errors while attempting to upload large files. Below are a couple of common cases and their solutions.

Handling memory errors

If you encounter a memory error such as NoMemoryError, try performing a resumable upload and setting the chunk_size option to a value that works for your environment, as explained in the final example above.

Handling broken pipe errors

To avoid broken pipe (Errno::EPIPE) errors when uploading, add the httpclient gem to your project, and the configuration shown below. These lines must execute after you require gcloud but before you make your first gcloud connection. The first statement configures Faraday to use httpclient. The second statement, which should only be added if you are using a version of Faraday at or above 0.9.2, is a workaround for this gzip issue.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
storage = gcloud.storage

bucket = storage.bucket "my-bucket"

bucket.create_file "path/to/local.file.ext"

examples.caption: Additionally, a destination path can be specified.
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
storage = gcloud.storage

bucket = storage.bucket "my-bucket"

bucket.create_file "path/to/local.file.ext",
                   "destination/path/file.ext"

examples.caption: Specify the chunk size as a number of bytes:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
storage = gcloud.storage

bucket = storage.bucket "my-bucket"

bucket.create_file "path/to/local.file.ext",
                   "destination/path/file.ext",
                   chunk_size: 1024*1024 # 1 MB chunk

require "gcloud"

# Use httpclient to avoid broken pipe errors with large uploads
Faraday.default_adapter = :httpclient

# Only add the following statement if using Faraday >= 0.9.2
# Override gzip middleware with no-op for httpclient
Faraday::Response.register_middleware :gzip =>
                                        Faraday::Response::Middleware

gcloud = Gcloud.new
storage = gcloud.storage

params.name: file
params.description: Path of the file on the filesystem to upload.

params.name: path
params.description: Path to store the file in Google Cloud Storage.

params.name: acl
params.description:
A predefined set of access controls to apply to this file.

Acceptable values are:

  • auth, auth_read, authenticated, authenticated_read, authenticatedRead - File owner gets OWNER access, and allAuthenticatedUsers get READER access.
  • owner_full, bucketOwnerFullControl - File owner gets OWNER access, and project team owners get OWNER access.
  • owner_read, bucketOwnerRead - File owner gets OWNER access, and project team owners get READER access.
  • private - File owner gets OWNER access.
  • project_private, projectPrivate - File owner gets OWNER access, and project team members get access according to their roles.
  • public, public_read, publicRead - File owner gets OWNER access, and allUsers get READER access.

params.name: cache_control
params.description: The Cache-Control response header to be returned when the file is downloaded.

params.name: content_disposition
params.description: The Content-Disposition response header to be returned when the file is downloaded.

params.name: content_encoding
params.description: The Content-Encoding response header to be returned when the file is downloaded.

params.name: content_language
params.description: The Content-Language response header to be returned when the file is downloaded.

params.name: content_type
params.description: The Content-Type response header to be returned when the file is downloaded.

params.name: chunk_size
params.description: The number of bytes per chunk in a resumable upload. Must be divisible by 256KB. If it is not divisible by 265KB then it will be lowered to the nearest acceptable value. If no value is provided it will use Gcloud::Upload.default_chunk_size. Optional.

params.name: crc32c
params.description: The CRC32c checksum of the file data, as described in RFC 4960, Appendix B. If provided, Cloud Storage will only create the file if the value matches the value calculated by the service. See Validation for more information.

params.name: md5
params.description: The MD5 hash of the file data. If provided, Cloud Storage will only create the file if the value matches the value calculated by the service. See Validation for more information.

params.name: metadata
params.description:
A hash of custom, user-provided web-safe keys and
arbitrary string values that will returned with requests for the file
as “x-goog-meta-“ response headers.

methods.name: acl
title: Gcloud
Storage
Bucket#acl
methods.description:
The Bucket::Acl instance used to control access to the bucket.

A bucket has owners, writers, and readers. Permissions can be granted to an individual user’s email address, a group’s email address, as well as many predefined lists.

examples.caption: Grant access to a user by pre-pending "user-" to an email:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
storage = gcloud.storage

bucket = storage.bucket "my-todo-app"

email = "heidi@example.net"
bucket.acl.add_reader "user-#{email}"

examples.caption: Grant access to a group by pre-pending "group-" to an email:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
storage = gcloud.storage

bucket = storage.bucket "my-todo-app"

email = "authors@example.net"
bucket.acl.add_reader "group-#{email}"

examples.caption: Or, grant access via a predefined permissions list:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
storage = gcloud.storage

bucket = storage.bucket "my-todo-app"

bucket.acl.public!

methods.name: default_acl
title: Gcloud
Storage
Bucket#default_acl
methods.description:
The Bucket::DefaultAcl instance used to control access to the bucket’s files.

A bucket’s files have owners, writers, and readers. Permissions can be granted to an individual user’s email address, a group’s email address, as well as many predefined lists.

examples.caption: Grant access to a user by pre-pending "user-" to an email:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
storage = gcloud.storage

bucket = storage.bucket "my-todo-app"

email = "heidi@example.net"
bucket.default_acl.add_reader "user-#{email}"

examples.caption: Grant access to a group by pre-pending "group-" to an email
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
storage = gcloud.storage

bucket = storage.bucket "my-todo-app"

email = "authors@example.net"
bucket.default_acl.add_reader "group-#{email}"

examples.caption: Or, grant access via a predefined permissions list:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
storage = gcloud.storage

bucket = storage.bucket "my-todo-app"

bucket.default_acl.public!

methods.name: reload!
title: Gcloud
Storage
Bucket#reload!
methods.description: Reloads the bucket with current data from the Storage service.
